sect1.title: rSTTask
sect1.para: Renders rST (reStructuredText) files into different output formats.
This task requires the python docutils installed. They contain rst2html, rst2latex, rst2man, rst2odt, rst2s5, rst2xml.

row.entry: Path to store the rendered file to. Used as directory if it ends with a /.
Only render if the input file is newer than the target file
Additional commandline parameters to the rst2* tool
The mode to create directories with.

listitem.para: mappers to generate output file names based on the rst ones
filter chains to e.g. replace variables after rendering
custom parameters to the rst2* tool

sect2.title: Examples
sect2.para: Render a single rST file to HTML
By default, HTML is generated. If no target file is specified, the input file name is taken, and its extension replaced with the correct one for the output format.
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="single"> <target name="single" description="render a single rST file to HTML">
<rST file="path/to/file.rst" />
</target> </project>
sect2.para: Render a single rST file to any supported format
The format attribute determines the output format:
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="single"> <target name="single" description="render a single rST file to S5 HTML">
<rST file="path/to/file.rst" format="s5" />
</target> </project>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="single"> <target name="single" description="render a single rST file">
<rST file="path/to/file.rst" destination="path/to/output/file.html" />
</target> </project>
sect2.para: A nested fileset tag may be used to specify multiple files.
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="multiple"> <target name="multiple" description="renders several rST files">
<rST> <fileset dir="."> <include name="README.rst" /> <include name="docs/*.rst" /> </fileset> </rST>
</target> </project>
sect2.para: Rendering multiple files to another directory
A nested mapper may be used to determine the output file names.
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="multiple"> <target name="multiple" description="renders several rST files">
<rST> <fileset dir="."> <include name="README.rst" /> <include name="docs/*.rst" /> </fileset> <mapper type="glob" from="*.rst" to="path/to/my/*.xhtml"/> </rST>
</target> </project>
sect2.para: You may have variables in your rST code that can be replaced after rendering, i.e. the version of your software.
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="filterchain"> <target name="filterchain" description="renders several rST files">
<rST> <fileset dir="."> <include name="README.rst" /> <include name="docs/*.rst" /> </fileset> <filterchain> <replacetokens begintoken="##" endtoken="##"> <token key="VERSION" value="1.23.0" /> </replacetokens> </filterchain> </rST>
</target> </project>
sect2.para: The uptodate attribute determines if only those files should be rendered that are newer than their output file.
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="multiple"> <target name="multiple" description="renders several rST files">
<rST uptodate="true"> <fileset dir="."> <include name="docs/*.rst" /> </fileset> </rST>
</target> </project>
sect2.para: You may pass any additional parameters to the rst conversion tools with the toolparam attribute.
sect2.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project name="example" basedir="." default="single"> <target name="single" description="render a single rST file to S5 HTML">
<rST file="path/to/file.rst" toolparam="--stylesheet-path=custom.css" />
</target> </project>
